p: Figure 3 (B to F) and related z test of mean values (see Materials and Methods) define the pillar industry of each city group. A city group’s pillar industry has the highest share in economic structure compared with other city groups. For example, the service sectors’ average share in GDP of the service-based cities (59%) is significantly higher than those of energy production (34%), heavy manufacturing (36%), light manufacturing (36%), and high-tech (43%) cities. Similarly, the energy production sectors’ average share in energy production cities (54%) is the highest among the five city groups.
